body: Looks great so far!
Run Spark ValidatesRunner

R: @tgroh 
CC: @echauchot @amitsela @iemejia 

The fix was to removed this `if`: https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/2746/files#diff-a274b31dd8c13d3e63a0c695f3485c5dL388
It causes `ParDo` to only work if you had 1 output exactly. Once you use multi output no datasets are put to the context.
Then it should be package private. But it actually is used so that won't work.
I can make it private and dupe it, that's reasonable.
It turns out the default behavior already makes tests that would use this work. It'll be some time wiping them out. Not critical enough to do right now.
Let's disable it then. It has obscured our signal for months. Infra needs to flip this switch? I'll wipe out the file here.
R: @dhalperi @tgroh
R: @kennknowles @tgroh
LGTM
LGTM.
Yes, Infra has to disable the switch. @jasonkuster
This will be best handled by an infra ticket -- I've filed https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/INFRA-14027 to track.

Well, we could make travis vacuous to get signal but I suppose it will not matter for long.
I predict this will be the first green PR in months :-)

@jbonofre The enforcer rule that I have added in this PR basically looks at all the classes within the artifacts generated by Beam (like `sdks-core-*.jar`, `examples-*.jar` etc.) and makes sure that we do not included unintended classes like `com.google.guava` or `org.apache.maven` etc. (configurable from the pom file). This is particularly useful for when using shade plugin to build a uber bundled jar but accidentally forget to shade libraries like guava.

run apex validatesrunner

LGTM, high-level scan only.

Analysis: Looks like a lot of moves. Spot-checked a few things and checked out.

4 files deleted, so -80 lines of license doesn't quite explain -200 lines overall. But another 10-15 of imports, plus some condensed testing does.

R: @dhalperi

This is a serious usability regression; I've seen the bug but am unconvinced we should change the spec (specifically the justification that "The use cases for these methods are best addressed by state plus window expiry callback" doesn't cover *most* of the uses I've seen.)
@robertwb Thanks. Can you comment on the issue as that is marked for the first stable release. I'll holdoff on this PR till we reach some resolution.

@aaltay, thanks for your review, I have updated the PR accordingly.
Regarding the python examples, I am willing to fix those as well and I will add the Python fix to this PR if that is all right with you. Or shall I open an other wone for the Python fix?

I have added beam-examples-java as a dependency of the beam-runners-spark, and that caused a problem with the maven-dependency-pugin. Shall I configure the maven-dependency-plugin to ignore this?

```
[INFO] --- maven-dependency-plugin:3.0.0:analyze-only (default) @ beam-runners-spark ---
[WARNING] Unused declared dependencies found:
[WARNING]    org.apache.beam:beam-examples-java:jar:0.7.0-SNAPSHOT:compile
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] BUILD FAILURE
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Total time: 01:39 min
[INFO] Finished at: 2017-04-28T12:54:28+02:00
[INFO] Final Memory: 83M/1508M
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-dependency-plugin:3.0.0:analyze-only (default) on project beam-runners-spark: Dependency problems found -> [Help 1]
org.apache.maven.lifecycle.LifecycleExecutionException: Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-dependency-plugin:3.0.0:analyze-only (default) on project beam-runners-spark: Dependency problems found

```

Well, it seems I introduced a cyclic reference in beam-runners-spark with adding beam-examples-java as a dependency. I will just remove it and hard code the pattern there.

`2017-04-28T11:01:34.128 [ERROR] The projects in the reactor contain a cyclic reference: Edge between 'Vertex{label='org.apache.beam:beam-examples-java:0.7.0-SNAPSHOT'}' and 'Vertex{label='org.apache.beam:beam-runners-spark:0.7.0-SNAPSHOT'}' introduces to cycle in the graph org.apache.beam:beam-runners-spark:0.7.0-SNAPSHOT --> org.apache.beam:beam-examples-java:0.7.0-SNAPSHOT --> org.apache.beam:beam-runners-spark:0.7.0-SNAPSHOT -> [Help 1]`

Any comment on what we are doing for now?

On Tue, Apr 25, 2017 at 4:09 PM, Reuven Lax <relax@google.com> wrote:

> Coders can provide an encoding id (Coder.getEncodingId) which can be used
> along with the class name to identify a Coder. As far as I can tell, none
> of our coders currently use this.
>
> On Tue, Apr 25, 2017 at 3:59 PM, Lukasz Cwik <notifications@github.com>
> wrote:
>
>> The plan is to drop the usage of Jackson as the payload format which was
>> convenient when adding to CloudObject and instead allow coders to provide
>> converters from Java/Python Coder -> Beam Runner API Coder (proto). This
>> would allow for Coders to define and maintain a stable format. Is there a
>> concern if this work to finish the Coder -> Beam Runner API Coder (proto)
>> occurs after first stable release?
>>
>> On Tue, Apr 25, 2017 at 3:48 PM, reuvenlax <notifications@github.com>
>> wrote:
>>
>> > In the past we've avoided using CustomCoder for most core coders due to
>> > it's use of Java Serializable. The Dataflow runner supports updating a
>> > running pipeline, and will fail the update if the coder appears to
>> change.
>> > Using Serializable to define the coder makes it very susceptible to
>> change
>> > on otherwise innocuous updates.
>> >
>> > —
>> > You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
>> > Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
>> > <https://github.com/apache/beam/pull/2612#issuecomment-297187463>, or
>> mute
>> > the thread
>> > <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/
>> AJnK7JTif6xTLX4csEXBvO_QKemNafUzks5rznhSgaJpZM4NDV3M>

>> .

Also, please title PR with `BEAM` not `Beam` -- the ASF bots look specifically for all caps to update the issues.
